name: Accordion
description: A portable musical instrument with bellows and buttons or keys, producing sound by forcing air through reeds.

name: Acoustic Guitar
description: A stringed instrument with a wooden body and sound hole, played by plucking or strumming the strings.

name: Alphorn
description: A traditional Swiss horn made of wood, often used in Alpine regions to produce deep and resonant tones.

name: Angklung
description: A traditional Indonesian musical instrument made of bamboo tubes, each producing a unique pitch when shaken.

name: Bagpipes
description: A wind instrument consisting of a bag, drones, and a chanter, commonly associated with Scottish and Irish music.

name: Balafon
description: A West African xylophone with wooden keys that are struck with mallets, producing melodic tones.

name: Balalaika
description: A Russian stringed instrument with a triangular body, often used in folk music.

name: Banjo
description: A stringed instrument with a round body and a long neck, often used in folk, country, and bluegrass music.

name: Bass Clarinet
description: A clarinet with a lower pitch range, known for its rich and deep tones in orchestral and jazz music.

name: Bass Drum
description: A large drum that produces deep and booming sounds, commonly used in marching bands and orchestras.

name: Bass Guitar
description: A stringed instrument with a longer scale length and lower pitch range, providing the rhythmic and harmonic foundation in many music genres.

name: Bassoon
description: A double-reed woodwind instrument with a deep and mellow tone, often used in classical and orchestral music.

name: Bodhran
description: A traditional Irish frame drum, played with a beater to create rhythmic patterns.

name: Bouzouki
description: A Greek stringed instrument with a long neck and a pear-shaped body, often used in traditional Greek music.

name: Cajon
description: A percussion instrument originating from Peru, played by slapping the front or rear panel with the hands.

name: Castanets
description: Handheld percussion instruments made of two small concave shells that are clicked together.

name: Cello
description: A stringed instrument played with a bow, known for its warm and expressive tones in classical music.

name: Charango
description: A small Andean stringed instrument, often made from an armadillo shell, used in folk music.

name: Clarinet
description: A woodwind instrument with a single-reed mouthpiece, capable of a wide range of tones in various music styles.

name: Clavinet
description: An electric keyboard instrument known for its funky and percussive sound, often used in funk and rock music.

name: Concertina
description: A small, hexagonal accordion-like instrument with buttons, producing sound by squeezing and expanding the bellows.

name: Contrabass
description: A large and deep-pitched stringed instrument, often used in orchestras to provide the lowest tones.

name: Cornet
description: A brass instrument similar to the trumpet, known for its mellow and melodic qualities in brass bands and jazz ensembles.

name: Cymbals
description: Percussion instruments consisting of two metal plates clashed together to create crashing or shimmering sounds.

name: Didgeridoo
description: A traditional Australian wind instrument made from a hollowed-out branch or tube, known for its unique drone-like sound.

name: Dizi
description: A Chinese transverse bamboo flute, known for its rich and expressive tones.

name: Djembe
description: A West African drum with a goblet shape and a skin head, played with the hands to produce a wide range of rhythms.

name: Dombra
description: A two-stringed traditional Kazakh instrument with a long neck, often used in Central Asian music.

name: Double Bass
description: A large stringed instrument, also known as the upright bass or contrabass, used in orchestras and jazz ensembles.

name: Drum Set
description: A collection of various drums and percussion instruments arranged for a single player, commonly used in rock, jazz, and pop music.

name: Dulcimer
description: A stringed instrument with a trapezoidal shape and a fretted neck, often played on the lap or with hammers.

name: Electric Guitar
description: A guitar with electronic pickups that amplify the sound, widely used in rock, blues, and other contemporary music genres.

name: Euphonium
description: A brass instrument resembling a small tuba, known for its mellow and expressive tones in brass bands and concert bands.

name: Fife
description: A small, high-pitched flute with six finger holes, often used in military and folk music.

name: Flugelhorn
description: A brass instrument resembling a trumpet but with a wider and more conical bore, often used in jazz and brass bands.

name: Flute
description: A woodwind instrument with a narrow cylindrical tube and a blowing edge, producing clear and melodious tones.

name: French Horn
description: A brass instrument with a coiled tube and a flared bell, known for its rich and mellow tones in orchestral and chamber music.

name: Gamelan
description: An Indonesian ensemble of percussion instruments, including metallophones, gongs, and drums, often used in traditional music.

name: Glockenspiel
description: A percussion instrument with tuned metal bars that are struck with mallets to produce bright and bell-like sounds.

name: Gong
description: A large metal disc-shaped percussion instrument, producing a deep and resonant sound when struck.

name: Grand Piano
description: A large and full-sized piano with a horizontal soundboard, offering a wide range of notes and dynamics in classical and modern music.

name: Guzheng
description: A traditional Chinese zither with strings stretched over a wooden frame, plucked to create melodic and expressive music.

name: Hammered Dulcimer
description: A percussion instrument with strings stretched over a trapezoidal soundboard, played by striking the strings with hammers.

name: Hang Drum
description: A modern percussion instrument with a UFO-like shape, known for its soothing and melodic sounds.

name: Hangul
description: A Korean traditional drum, often played in various ceremonial and cultural events.

name: Harmonica
description: A small wind instrument with reeds, played by blowing and drawing air through the holes to produce varying musical notes.

name: Harp
description: A large stringed instrument with a frame and multiple strings, played by plucking the strings to create ethereal and resonant sounds.

name: Harpsichord
description: A keyboard instrument with strings that are plucked by quills, producing a distinctive harpsichord sound in classical music.

name: Jew's Harp
description: A small musical instrument played by vibrating a flexible metal or bamboo tongue, often held against the player's mouth.

name: Kalimba
description: An African thumb piano with metal tines, played by plucking the tines to create melodic and rhythmic patterns.

name: Keyboard
description: A musical instrument with a set of keys, often referring to electronic keyboards and synthesizers used in various music genres.

name: Khaen
description: A traditional Laotian and Thai mouth organ made of bamboo, producing harmonious sounds.

name: Konghou
description: An ancient Chinese harp with strings plucked by fingers or a plectrum, known for its elegant tones.

name: Koto
description: A traditional Japanese stringed instrument with 13 strings, plucked to produce beautiful and melodic music.

name: Lute
description: A stringed instrument with a rounded body and a fretted neck, popular in European music during the Renaissance and Baroque eras.

name: Lyre
description: A stringed instrument with a U-shaped body and strings stretched between two arms, used in ancient and classical music.

name: Mandolin
description: A small stringed instrument with a rounded body and a fretted neck, often used in folk, bluegrass, and classical music.

name: Maracas
description: Percussion instruments consisting of gourd shells filled with seeds or beads, shaken to produce rhythmic and shaking sounds.

name: Marimba
description: A percussion instrument with wooden bars arranged like a keyboard, played with mallets to create melodic and resonant tones.

name: Mbira
description: A traditional African thumb piano with metal tines, played by plucking to create intricate melodies.

name: Mellotron
description: An early keyboard instrument that uses tape loops to produce various sounds, popular in progressive rock music.

name: Ney
description: A Middle Eastern flute made of cane, known for its haunting and meditative sounds.

name: Nyckelharpa
description: A Swedish stringed instrument with keys that press against the strings, producing a unique and resonant tone.

name: Nylon String Guitar
description: A classical guitar with nylon strings, known for its warm and mellow tones in classical and acoustic music.

name: Oboe
description: A double-reed woodwind instrument with a conical bore, known for its distinct and piercing tones in orchestral and chamber music.

name: Ocarina
description: A small wind instrument with finger holes, often shaped like a sweet potato or an animal, known for its pure and haunting tones.

name: Octobass
description: A massive and rare stringed instrument, known for its extremely low tones and enormous size.

name: Oud
description: A stringed instrument with a pear-shaped body, commonly used in Middle Eastern and North African music.

name: Overtone Flute
description: A flute that allows players to produce overtones and harmonics, creating ethereal and mystical sounds.

name: Pan Flute
description: A musical instrument consisting of a series of tubes or pipes of varying lengths, played by blowing across the open ends.

name: Pandora's Box
description: An electronic musical instrument capable of producing a wide range of sounds and effects.

name: Penny Whistle
description: A small wind instrument, also known as a tin whistle, played by blowing air through a fipple to create simple and melodious tunes.

name: Piccolo
description: A small woodwind instrument, similar to the flute but smaller, known for its high-pitched and bright tones.

name: Pipa
description: A Chinese plucked string instrument with a pear-shaped body, often used in traditional and classical music.

name: Pipe Organ
description: A keyboard instrument that generates sound by pushing air through a series of pipes of varying lengths and materials.

name: Quena
description: A traditional Andean flute made of bamboo, used in indigenous music from South America.

name: Rain Drum
description: A Southeast Asian percussion instrument shaped like a large barrel, played by tapping the surface to mimic the sound of raindrops.

name: Rainstick
description: A percussion instrument made from a hollowed cactus stem filled with small pebbles or beans, producing a sound reminiscent of falling rain.

name: Recorder
description: A woodwind instrument with a whistle mouthpiece, often used for teaching music to beginners.

name: Sarangi
description: A traditional stringed instrument from India, often used in classical and folk music.

name: Saxophone
description: A family of woodwind instruments with a single-reed mouthpiece, known for their versatility in various music genres.

name: Saz
description: A Turkish stringed instrument with a long neck, often used in Turkish folk and classical music.

name: Shakuhachi
description: A traditional Japanese bamboo flute with five finger holes, known for its serene and meditative sounds.

name: Shamisen
description: A traditional Japanese three-stringed instrument with a long neck, often played with a plectrum.

name: Shofar
description: A Jewish ceremonial horn typically made from a ram's horn, used in religious rituals and music.

name: Sihu
description: A traditional Chinese bowed string instrument, known for its unique and haunting tones.

name: Sitar
description: A plucked string instrument from India, known for its resonant and melodic tones in classical and traditional music.

name: Snare Drum
description: A small drum with snares (wires or strings) stretched across the bottom head, producing a sharp and snappy sound.

name: Sousaphone
description: A large brass instrument resembling a tuba, often used in marching bands.

name: Steel Drum
description: A percussion instrument made from a metal oil drum, played by striking the tuned areas with mallets.

name: Steel Pan
description: A Caribbean percussion instrument made from oil drums, known for its bright and melodic tones.

name: Suvorov Trumpet
description: A Russian military trumpet with a distinctive shape, used in military parades and ceremonies.

name: Synthesizer
description: An electronic musical instrument that generates sound through synthesizing and manipulating audio signals.

name: Taiko Drum
description: A traditional Japanese drum of various sizes, often used in ensemble performances and festivals.

name: Taishogoto
description: A Japanese stringed instrument with a keyboard, often used in traditional and modern music.

name: Tambourine
description: A handheld percussion instrument with jingling metal disks or pairs of small cymbals, often used in various music genres.

name: Thavil
description: A South Indian double-headed drum, often used in classical and folk music.

name: Theremin
description: An electronic instrument played without physical contact, using hand gestures to control pitch and volume.

name: Tible
description: A traditional Tibetan flute made of bamboo, producing serene and melodic sounds.

name: Timpani
description: Large kettle drums played with mallets, often used in orchestral music to provide deep and resonant percussive sounds.

name: Tin Whistle
description: A small wind instrument with six finger holes, often used in Celtic and folk music.

name: Triangle
description: A simple percussion instrument made of a metal rod bent into a triangular shape, often struck with a metal beater.

name: Trombone
description: A brass instrument with a sliding tube, known for its smooth and bold tones in various music genres.

name: Trumpet
description: A brass instrument with three valves, capable of producing bright and clear tones, often used in orchestras and bands.

name: Tsymbaly
description: A Ukrainian dulcimer with strings played by striking with mallets, creating lively and vibrant music.

name: Tuba
description: A large brass instrument with a wide and conical bore, providing the deep and resonant low tones in brass bands and orchestras.

name: Uilleann Pipes
description: A traditional Irish bagpipe with bellows, known for its melodious and expressive tones.

name: Ukulele
description: A small, four-stringed instrument from Hawaii, often associated with tropical and folk music.

name: Vibraphone
description: A percussion instrument with metal bars and resonators, often played with mallets to produce soft and shimmering tones.

name: Viola
description: A stringed instrument slightly larger than a violin, known for its warm and mellow tones in orchestras and chamber music.

name: Viola da Gamba
description: A stringed instrument with frets and multiple strings, often used in Renaissance and Baroque music.

name: Violin
description: A stringed instrument played with a bow, known for its versatile and expressive tones in classical and various music genres.

name: Washboard
description: A percussion instrument consisting of a ridged metal surface, played with thimbles or spoons.

name: Xylophone
description: A percussion instrument with wooden bars and resonators, played with mallets to produce bright and melodic tones.

name: Yangqin
description: A Chinese hammered dulcimer with strings stretched over a trapezoidal soundboard, played with bamboo mallets.

name: Zither
description: A stringed instrument with strings stretched across a flat soundboard, played by plucking or strumming to create harmonious melodies.

name: Zurna
description: A traditional wind instrument with a double reed, often used in Middle Eastern and Eastern European music.
